title: Theodor W. Adorno - Philosophical Works (30 books)
description:
THEODOR W. ADORNO (1903-1969) was a German sociologist, philosopher and musicologist famous for his work in critical theory.  A leading member of the "Frankfurt School" of social research, his work was associated with thinkers such as Ernst Bloch, Walter Benjamin, Max Horkheimer and Herbert Marcuse, for whom the work of Freud, Marx and Hegel were essential to a critique of modern society.  He is widely regarded as one of the 20th century's foremost thinkers on aesthetics and philosophy, as well as one of its preeminent essayists.


==> CONTENTS: In addition to several new titles, this updated torrent includes many ePUB editions of books previously available only in PDF.


The following books are in PDF and/or ePUB format as indicated:

* AESTHETIC THEORY (Continuum, 2002 / Bloomsbury, 2013).  Edited by Gretel Adorno and Rolf Tiedemann; newly translated by Robert Hullot-Kentor. -- PDF + ePUB

* AESTHETICS AND POLITICS (Verso, 1980).  With Ernst Bloch, Bertolt Brecht, Georg LukÃ¡cs, and Walter Benjamin.  Afterword by Fredric Jameson. -- PDF

* AGAINST EPISTEMOLOGY: A Metacritique (Polity, 2013).  Translated by Willis Domingo. -- PDF + ePUB

* THE AUTHORITARIAN PERSONALITY [with Else Frenkel-Brunswik, Daniel J. Levinson, and R. Nevitt Sanford] (Harper & Bros., 1950). -- PDF

* BEETHOVEN: The Philosophy of Music (Polity, 2002).  Edited by Rolf Tiedemann.  Translated by Edmund Jephcott. -- ePUB

* CORRESPONDENCE 1925-1935 [with Alban Berg] (Polity, 2005).  Edited by Henri Lonitz; translated by Wieland Hoban. -- PDF + ePUB

* CORRESPONDENCE 1943-1955 [with Thomas Mann] (Polity, 2006).  Edited by Christoph GÃ¶dde and Thomas Sprecher; translated by Nicholas Walker. -- PDF + ePUB

* CRITICAL MODELS: Interventions and Catchwords (Columbia UP, 2005).  Translated by Henry W. Pickford. -- ePUB

* THE CULTURE INDUSTRY: Selected Essays on Mass Culture (Routledge, 1991).  Edited and with an introduction by J. M. Bernstein. -- PDF + ePUB

* CURRENT OF MUSIC: Elements of a Radio Theory (Polity, 2009).  Edited with an Introduction by Robert Hullot-Kentor. -- PDF + ePUB

* DIALECTIC OF ENLIGHTENMENT [with Max Horkheimer] (Stanford UP, 2002).  Edited by Gunzelin Schmid Noerr; translated by Edmund ]ephcott. -- PDF

* DREAM NOTES (Polity, 2007).  Edited by Christoph GÃ¶dde and Henri Lonitz; translated by Rodney Livingstone. -- PDF + ePUB

* HEGEL: Three Studies (MIT, 1993).  Translated by Shierry Weber Nicholsen. -- PDF

* HISTORY AND FREEDOM: Lectures 1964-1965 (Polity, 2006).  Edited by Rolf Tiedemann; translated by Rodney Livingstone. -- PDF + ePUB

* INTRODUCTION TO SOCIOLOGY (Stanford UP, 2000).  Edited by Christoph GÃ¶dde; translated by Edmund Jephcott. -- PDF + ePUB

* THE JARGON OF AUTHENTICITY (Northwestern UP, 1973 / Routledge, 2003).  Translated by Knut Tarnowski and Frederic Will. -- PDF + ePUB

* KANT'S CRITIQUE OF PURE REASON (Stanford UP, 2001).  Edited by Rolf Tiedemann; translated by Rodney Livingstone. -- PDF

* LECTURES ON NEGATIVE DIALECTICS: Fragments of a Lecture Course 1965/1966 (Polity, 2008).  Edited by Rolf Tiedemann; translated by Rodney Livingstone. -- PDF + ePUB

* LETTERS TO HIS PARENTS, 1939-1951 (Polity, 2006).  Edited by Christoph GÃ¶dde and Henri Lonitz; translated by Wieland Hoban. -- PDF + ePUB

* MAHLER: A Musical Physiognomy (University of Chicago Press, 1992).  Translated by Edmund Jephcott. -- PDF + ePUB

* METAPHYSICS: Concept and Problems (Stanford UP, 2000).  Edited by Rolf Tiedemann; translated by Edmund Jephcott. -- PDF + ePUB

* MINIMA MORALIA: Reflections on a Damaged Life (Verso, 2005).  Translated by E.F.N. Jepfcott. -- PDF

* NEGATIVE DIALECTICS (Routledge, 1973).  Translated by E. B. Ashton. -- PDF

* NOTES TO LITERATURE (Columbia UP, 1991-92).  2 vols.  Translated by Sherry Weber Nicholsen. -- PDF

* THE POSITIVIST DISPUTE IN GERMAN SOCIOLOGY [with Hans Albert, Ralf Dahrendorf, Jurgen Habermas, Harald Pilot, and Karl R. Popper] (Heinemann, 1976).  Translated by Glyn Adey and David Frisby. -- PDF

* PROBLEMS OF MORAL PHILOSOPHY (Stanford UP, 2000).  Edited by Thomas Schroder; translated by Rodney Livingstone. -- PDF + ePUB

* THE STARS DOWN TO EARTH & Other Essays on the Irrational in Culture (Routledge, 1994).  Edited and with an introduction by Stephen Crook. -- PDF + ePUB

* TOWARDS A NEW MANIFESTO [with Max Horkheimer] (Verso, 2011).  Translated by Rodney Livingstone. -- ePUB

* TOWARDS A THEORY OF MUSICAL REPRODUCTION: Notes, a Draft and Two Schemata (Polity, 2006).  Edited by Henri Lonitz.  Translated by Wieland Hoban. -- PDF + ePUB
